data.title: Special Newsletter! Business Mission to Bahrain, KSA and the UAE
data.text:
The Joint Italian Arab Chamber of Commerce is proud to have led the BusinessMission in Bahrain, paving the way to leading Italian companies such as AlmavivA S.p.A., Impresa Pizzarotti & C. S.p.A., Salini Impregilo, SACE, Sudelettra S.p.A. and Trevi Group.

The mission, led by JIACC President Mr. Cesare Trevisani, was an excellent occasion to discover and discuss top business opportunities with high-level institutional and private counterparts. Throughout the mission we also promoted Italy as a strategic partner for the implementation of Bahrain Vision 2030, which will feature infrastructure mega projects, as well as other significant projects in real estate, manufacturing and logistics. Finally, the mission confirmed JIACC as a reliable promoter of Bahrain in Italy, opening up new opportunities for future official collaborations. For example, JIACC officially invited in Italy H.E. Sheikh Mohammed Ahmed Sultan Al-Khalifa, Undersecretary for Agriculture & Marine Resources of Bahrain, to visit agriculture and agribusiness companies for investment prospects and partnerships.

We would like to thank H.E. Zayed bin Rashid al Zayani, Minister of Industry, Commerce and Tourism, H.E. Essam bin Abdulla Khalaf, Minister of Works, Municipalities and Urban Planning, , Mr. Simon Galpin, Managing Director of the Bahrain EDB, Ms. Nada Yousif Latif Deen from the Ministry of Transportation & Telecomunication and all other Bahraini counterparts for having received us and for having contributed to the success of this mission.

A special thanks goes to the Ambassador of Italy in Bahrain, H.E. Domenico Bellato and to H.E. Sameer Nass, Chairman of the Bahrain Chamber of Commerce & Industry for their invaluable support.

We had the honor to meet with H.E. Zayed bin Rashid Al Zayani, Minister of Industry, Commerce and Tourism of Bahrain,who was present as Keynote Speaker in the 2017 First Italian-Arab Business Forum, leading the official delegation of Bahrain. After carefully listening to the presentation of Italian companies part of the delegation, the Minister clearly presented the Bahrain Vision 2030 and the role Italian companies can play in the implementation of the the national's Vision. The Minister called for an increase of cross-investments as a tool for stronger economic ties, underlining the strategic role of Bahrain as a first-class regional and international hub. The Minister also mentioned as an example of cooperation the Global Entrepreneurship Congress, an event gathering together thousands of entrepreneurs, investors, researchers, policymakers from more than 170 countries, to be held this year in Bahrain.

Finally, JIACC President Mr. Cesare Trevisani, with JIACC Vice Presidents Mr. Pietro Paolo Rampino and Mr. Ahmed Al Midfa, and Ms. Domitilla Gacci, Head of Rome Office, ended the mission in the United Arab Emirates, one of Italy's most important Arab commercial partners and Guest Country of the 2018 Second Italian Arab Business Forum.

This last part of the business trip provided the opportunity to follow-up on the Second-Italian Business Forum, held in Rome the 17 October 2018.

A special thank goes to H.E. Liborio Stellino, Ambassador of Italy to the United Arab Emirates, for his continuous support to our activities.
